text:
Two questions for anyone who may know...
1) The hubble code for blog subscribe is this. But when I render it on the page in an html template it outputs the html. I was hoping to find the raw file itself so that I could fit it to a bootstrap 4 layout but no such luck.
2) Does the site search module work in preview mode? I have implemented the module using its core code but it won't output search results.
A visual representation of the output

<@UG9TDT52N> blog subscribe is  basically just a shortcut to the form tag,

which basically injects the HubSpot form embed code.

The embed is JS react based. you cannot change it’s html. You can use css to style it, and you could use a dummy form if you have to create the exact form styles in bootstrap. Otherwise just use CSS to make it look how you want. everything has classes on it already.
ah right I see. okay I will sort it with css then. thanks
Any thoughts on the Site search not working in preview mode <@U7SL518D6>? If implemented properly, should it show a search result even in preview?
inspect it, look for javascript errors, likely will tell you what’s wrong.
There is an error: Server reached, error retrieving results. This not only happens on my .html version but also the current live template if I add a search to it and press preview
I suspect it is a preview error given that the changes I made to a cloned copy of the search module were two divs and 2 class changes.
Does anyone know how to style AMP pages within HubSpot or if this is possible? First time working with AMP.
Under content settings >blog they have a very basic set of controls for styling it
Thats all there is at least at this time
My client wants to italicize certain words in their HubSpot CMS Blog post titles...is this possible? The default HubSpot CMS Blog post title field is a text field (not a rich text field)
Did you try adding some html within the field? Usually I’ll just have clients wrap word in <em> tags if they need that functionality.
